description.narrative: SDC Project will be undertaken to contribute to the design of strategies to be implemented during IP2. This includes: - A study in Cambodia assessing the impact of changes to the Mekong River flow regime on biodiversity and livelihoods of riverine communities in the Mekong and Tonle Sap (Great Lake) . This will complement the Political, Economic and Stakeholder analysis in Cambodia. - A national dialogue event on women’s leadership in water governance and renewable energy in the Mekong Delta-3S regionin Vietnam. This will be informed by the Cost Effectiveness Study and also the Political, Economic and Stakeholder analysis. - A national dialogue eventin Lao PDR to assess the status of civil society in water governance and develop strategies for the future of the Lao PDR Natural Resources and River Network or equivalent. This will be based on the outcomes of the Political, Economic and Stakeholder analysis in Lao PDR and will link to the established civil society organisations and networks in Vietnam. - A dialogue and planning event in Cambodia to support the Ministry of Environment (MoE) to develop a gender mainstreaming policy. This will be based on the Cost Effectiveness study and Cambodia Mekong Impact Assessment (proposed Activity 4.13) and will lead to strategies and plans to integrate gendered social impact analysis into water infrastructure. The MoE has a key role to play in promoting environmental and social impact assessment for water infrastructure including in protected areas such as on the Mekong and in the Tonle Sap Region. - A civil society strategic planning event in Thailand based on the outcomes of the Political, Economic and Stakeholder analysis in Thailand and the Cost Effectiveness Study. This event will develop key strategies for the full IP2 in Thailand and at the regional level. - A design process (consultant and workshop) to develop plans to pilot protocols for community consultation on water infrastructure projects, which would inform strategies to influence water governance actors on more meaningful engagement with affected communities. The development of consultation protocols will be implemented from Year 2. - Develop, translate and publish a summary brief on the dam scope hydropower risk analysis (Activity 3.3.24) toinform strategies to engage with hydro-power actors across the region. Translate International Rivers’ gender guide into Thai and Khmer to strengthen gender mainstreaming into partner plans and activities in IP2.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education forall, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project#s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
